intro: Pemphis angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf pemphis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along waterways, thriving in moist to saturated soils. It features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
